meanings.definition: A loud, deep, prolonged sound uttered by a lion or other large wild animal.
meanings.sent1: The lion's roar echoed through the jungle.
meanings.sent2: I heard the roar of a lion at the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The roar of the lion scared the little monkey.
meanings.sent4: The roar of the crowd filled the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The roar of the waterfall was deafening.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, deep, prolonged sound.
meanings.sent1: The lion will roar when it is hungry.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the lion roar from afar.
meanings.sent3: Don't make me roar with laughter!
meanings.sent4: The engine began to roar as the car accelerated.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds started to roar with thunder.

meanings.definition: A loud, deep, prolonged sound resembling the cry of a wild animal.
meanings.sent1: The roar of the wind sounded like a wild animal.
meanings.sent2: I mistook the roar of the wind for a howl.
meanings.sent3: The roar of the wind made the trees dance.
meanings.sent4: The roar of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The roar of the thunderstorm was ominous.
